meanings.definition: The act of being in the company of others as equals.
meanings.sent1: During the picnic, the fellowing of friends around the table was heartwarming.
meanings.sent2: In the classroom, the fellowing of students during group projects was encouraged.
meanings.sent3: The fellowing of animals at the zoo made the visitors smile.
meanings.sent4: The fellowing of stars in the night sky created a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The fellowing of colors in the painting brought it to life.

meanings.definition: To associate or socialize with others in a friendly manner.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys fellowing with her neighbors over coffee in the mornings.
meanings.sent2: The team members were fellowing after work to celebrate their success.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be fellowing with the birds outside the window.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden were fellowing with the bees and butterflies.
meanings.sent5: The children were fellowing happily at the playground.
